glsa.title: ImageMagick, GraphicsMagick: Denial of Service vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: ImageMagick and GraphicsMagick utilities can be abused to perform a Denial of Service attack.

background.p: Both ImageMagick and GraphicsMagick are collection of tools to read, write and manipulate images in many formats.

description.p: Tavis Ormandy of the Gentoo Linux Security Audit Team discovered a Denial of Service vulnerability in the XWD decoder of ImageMagick and GraphicsMagick when setting a color mask to zero.

impact.p: A remote attacker could submit a specially crafted image to a user or an automated system making use of an affected utility, resulting in a Denial of Service by consumption of CPU time.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
